headline: Stocks Pare Losses After Bessent’s Trade Remarks: Markets Wrap
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Wall Street’s mood remained bound to the repercussions of President Donald Trump’s trade war, with stocks moving away from session lows after Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent signaled negotiations with several commercial partners are going well.Most Read from BloombergThe Battle Over the Fate of Detroit’s Renaissance CenterNYC Real Estate Industry Asks Judge to Block New Broker Fee LawNJ Transit Strike Would Be ‘Disaster’ for Region, Sherrill SaysIceland Plans for a More Volcanic

headline: DoorDash buys SevenRooms, Constellation Energy, Marriott outlook
summary: DoorDash (DASH) will acquire SevenRooms in a $1.2 billion deal, while the delivery app also announced its purchase of Deliveroo (ROO.L). Constellation Energy (CEG) fell shy of first quarter profit estimates. The energy company is maintaining its full-year outlook. Marriott International (MAR) lowers its full-year guidance, the latest hotel operator to report uncertainties tied to global trade wars and tariffs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
